content.question: Two conducting spheres are isolated from their surroundings. The radii of spheres <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="one half R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>R/2</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively. Initially sphere <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> has charge <math alttext="positive Q" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and sphere <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is neutral. A wire is connected between the sphere. Which of the following gives the final charge on each sphere after equilibrium is reached and provides a statement of reasoning to support this claim?

choices.label: <math alttext="Q sub A equals Q and Q sub B equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mi>Q</mi><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must create the same electric field at their surface.

<math alttext="Q sub A equals the fraction Q over 2, and Q sub B equals the fraction Q over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must create the same electric field at their surface.

<math alttext="Q sub A equals the fraction 2 Q over 3, and Q sub B equals the fraction Q over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must create the same electric field at their surface.

<math alttext="Q sub A equals the fraction Q over 2, and Q sub B equals the fraction Q over 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must be at the same electric potential.

<math alttext="Q sub A equals the fraction 2 Q over 3, and Q sub B equals the fraction Q over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must be at the same electric potential.

content.answer: <math alttext="Q sub A equals the fraction 2 Q over 3, and Q sub B equals the fraction Q over 3" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>,</mo><msub><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>B</mi></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>Q</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>, because both spheres must be at the same electric potential.
